Functions

void free (void *ap)
 Frees up the user memory pointed by ap for futures mallocs.
void * malloc (size_t nbytes)
 returns a continuous segment of user memory. It could return null if there is not enough free space.
void * realloc (void *ap, size_t size)
 Changes the original size of the continuous memory. If it is possible, it moves the old segment of user memory to a new continuous user memory segment .

Detailed Description

User malloc module.

Author:
Luciano Zemin, Nicolás Magni, Nicolás Purita

void free ( void *  ap  ) 

Frees up the user memory pointed by ap for futures mallocs.

Parameters:
ap Pointer to the logical memory position that would be freed.

void * malloc ( size_t  nbytes  ) 

returns a continuous segment of user memory. It could return null if there is not enough free space.

Parameters:
nbytes The size of continuous memory that would be returned.
Returns:
The logical user memory to be used.

void * realloc ( void *  ap,
size_t  size 
)

Changes the original size of the continuous memory. If it is possible, it moves the old segment of user memory to a new continuous user memory segment .

Parameters:
ap The old position that would be changed if it's necessary.
size The new size of the continuous user memory.
Returns:
A new continuous segment of user memory.
See also:
free() malloc()
